security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill that generates markdown planning files for Django backend projects. All 290 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES: the 'backtick execution' patterns are markdown code block syntax (not Ruby execution), 'reconnaissance' patterns are normal text in task dependencies, 'weak cryptographic algorithm' and 'obfuscation' are false pattern matches in YAML frontmatter and JSON metadata. No executable code, no network calls, no malicious patterns. This skill only creates text files.

content.value_statement: This skill creates structured implementation plans with quality gates for Django projects. Use it to break down complex backend features into Ralph Loop-compatible tasks with built-in verification steps.
actual_capabilities: Creates PLAN.md with structured task breakdown and tracking tables
Generates RALPH-PROMPT.md for Ralph Loop execution
Defines quality gates (lint, test, coverage, types, Django checks)
Tracks task dependencies and execution order
Produces task files with checklists, tests, and completion criteria
limitations: Designed specifically for Django backend projects
Requires Ralph Wiggum Loop skill for execution
Needs existing Django project structure with tests configured
Best suited for multi-task features, not single quick tasks

best_practices: Keep tasks focused with 4-8 checklist items for optimal Ralph iteration cycles
Use specific test filters to isolate feature tests and reduce execution time
Add orientation tasks when working with unfamiliar codebases
Configure project-specific wrapper commands in the tooling section
anti_patterns: Creating tasks with more than 10 checklist items (too complex for single iteration)
Skipping dependency mapping between tasks (causes Ralph to get stuck)
Using generic completion promises instead of plan-specific ones
Forgetting to configure project-specific tool commands

faq.question: What is Ralph Wiggum Loop?
faq.answer: Ralph Loop is an iterative pattern where Claude repeatedly executes the same prompt, seeing previous work via git history.

faq.question: Can I use this for non-Django projects?
faq.answer: This skill is Django-specific. Other frameworks would need their own planning templates and quality gates.

faq.question: How do I run the generated plan?
faq.answer: Use '/plan-directory:run <slug>' to execute the RALPH-PROMPT.md with Ralph Loop integration.

faq.question: What if tests fail during execution?
faq.answer: Ralph will attempt to fix issues. The plan includes verification steps that must pass before proceeding to next task.

faq.question: Can I customize the quality gates?
faq.answer: Yes, configure lint, format, type check, and test commands to match your project's tooling setup.

faq.question: How does task tracking work?
faq.answer: Ralph updates PLAN.md after each task, marking status and filling quality gate results in the tracker table.
